[LEXICON]: Overly archaic vocabulary (e.g., "wonted devotion," "revelry") may impede modern readability.
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "The work is submitted to the reader in the hope that it will prove to be pregnant with interest...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between topics (e.g., from ship departure to Honolulu landmarks without clear links).
[CLARITY]: Repetitive undefined term ("the thing") disrupts contextual understanding.

[LEXICON]: "stuff and Calcutta" (likely typo for "from Calcutta" or similar)
[SYNTAX]: Awkward sentence structure in vehicle/pedestrian description

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt shift from personal discomfort to historical context without explicit link
[TRANSITION]: Sudden jump from bridge scene to administrative notice
